channel.title: Rockbox (Open Source Jukebox Firmware)
channel.description:
This is sort of half way between computer hardware and 3rd party programs/Linux so I post it here. (Please move to one of these sections if appropriate)
[b]What is Rockbox? What is its purpose? [/b] Rockbox is an Open Source replacement firmware for portable digital audio players. A list of supported players can be found on the frontpage. For a more detailed list and for a list with targets under development see TargetStatus. Rockbox is a complete rewrite and uses no fragments of the original firmware. It boasts numerous features while remaining easy to use.
We all love Linux because its open source so now we can love our mp3/mp4 firmware with this. The most used firmware from Rockbox is probably the IPod ones however you need to make sure its compatiable: [b]Apple[/b]: 1st through 5.5th generation iPod, iPod Mini and 1st generation iPod Nano (not the Shuffle, 2nd/3rd/4th gen Nano, Classic or Touch) ie. the old ones
http://www.rockbox.org/
[img]http://themes.rockbox.org/themes/176x132/ubuntu/wps-ubuntu.png[/img]
[img]http://themes.rockbox.org/themes/176x132/.rockbox-1/wps-PHI-infoScreen-shot.PNG[/img]
[img]http://themes.rockbox.org/themes/176x132/amarok/wps-amarok.png[/img]

item.title: Rockbox (Open Source Jukebox Firmware)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

This is sort of half way between computer hardware and 3rd party programs/Linux so I post it here. (Please move to one of these sections if appropriate)

What is Rockbox? What is its purpose?

Rockbox is an Open Source replacement firmware for portable digital audio players. A list of supported players can be found on the frontpage. For a more detailed list and for a list with targets under development see TargetStatus.
Rockbox is a complete rewrite and uses no fragments of the original firmware. It boasts numerous features while remaining easy to use.

We all love Linux because its open source so now we can love our mp3/mp4 firmware with this.
The most used firmware from Rockbox is probably the IPod ones however you need to make sure its compatiable:
Apple: 1st through 5.5th generation iPod, iPod Mini and 1st generation iPod Nano
(not the Shuffle, 2nd/3rd/4th gen Nano, Classic or Touch)
ie. the old ones

http://www.rockbox.org/

Read full topic
